Detailed Description

This class is used to represent a quaternion.

Quaternions are useful when working with angles in 3 dimensions.

Member Function Documentation

float Quaternion::dotProduct ( const Quaternion &  q  )  const

This method returns the dot product of this quaternion with the input quaternion.

Parameters:
q The quaternion to perform the dot product with.
Returns:
The dot product of this quaternion.

void Quaternion::fromAngleAxis ( float  angle,
const Vector3 &  axis 
)

This method initialises this quaternion base on the input angle and axis.

The input parameters describe a rotation in 3 dimensions.

Parameters:
angle The angle in radians to rotate around the input axis.
axis The axis to rotate around.

void Quaternion::fromMatrix ( const Matrix &  m  ) 

This method initialises this quaternion based on the rotation in the input matrix.

The translation present in the matrix is not used.

Parameters:
m The matrix to set this quaternion from.

void Quaternion::invert (  ) 

This method inverts this quaternion.

This function returns the length of this quaternion.

This function returns the squared length of this quaternion.

This method makes the w member of this quaternion non-negative.

void Quaternion::multiply ( const Quaternion &  q1,
const Quaternion &  q2 
)

This method sets this quaternion to be the rotation that would result by applying the rotation of q1 and then the rotation of q2.

void Quaternion::normalise (  ) 

This method normalises this quaternion.

That is, it makes sure that the quaternion has a length of 1.

void Quaternion::postMultiply ( const Quaternion &  q  ) 

This method post-multiplies this quaternion by the input quaternion.

This quaternion is set to the result.

See also:
multiply

void Quaternion::preMultiply ( const Quaternion &  q  ) 

This method pre-multiplies this quaternion by the input quaternion.

This quaternion is set to the result.

See also:
